Representative_Docs: ['Diane Rae Gunter Birth: 1939 Death: 2025 Diane Rae Gunter, 86, passed on November 2, 2025 at her home in Soquel surrounded by family. Born May 13, 1939, in Soquel, she graduated from Santa Cruz high school where she met her husband, Jesse Edwin Gunter. She is survived by her daughter, son, grandchildren, and great grandchildren and is pre-deceased by her husband. Diane taught swimming to children for many years at Polly’s Puddle and spent her career working in a sheltered workshop for disabled adults in Oregon. She was an avid tennis and softball player early in life, and she found her love for golf later. She spent much of her time in her garden, often ending the day with a pint of her favorite Guinness. She enjoyed traveling and spending time with family and friends. Diane lived her life on her terms and will be missed by all. A celebration of life will be held January 17, 2026, at DeLaveaga Golf Course from 3 to 6 pm. Honor with Flowers In memory of Diane Rae Plant a Living Memorial In memory of Diane Rae', 'Janet Marie Flores Birth: 1931 Death: 2025 Janet Marie Flores passed away peacefully on November 21, 2025 at the age of 94 surrounded by the love of her family. Jan was born on October 31, 1931 in San Francisco to loving parents Alice Detour and Joseph Hettrick. Jan was a loving mother, grandmother and great grandmother who found her greatest joy in her family. She had a way of making people feel welcomed. She was kind, big hearted, extremely gracious and devoted to those she loved. Her presence will be deeply missed. Jan lived a long life traveling, playing golf, bunco with her friends and one of her greatest talents was to find a treasure at garage sales. In her final years she enjoyed playing penny slots at the casino. The last nine years Jan spent in the loving care of her daughter and son in law. A special thank you to her granddaughter Samantha for making her last days warm, comfortable and full of love. Jan survived by her daughter Tina Schilling (Michael), her grandchildren Michael (Marissa), Paul (Kacie), Samantha (Carlos), and her nine great grandchildren Jackson, Aubrey, Jordan, Mikey, Ellie, Luna, Ryder, Makayla and Stella. And her friends who will forever cherish her memory. Representative_Docs: ['HNL Lab Medicine Brings Escape Room Fun to Hospital Education ALLENTOWN, Pa., Nov. 10, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- HNL Lab Medicine is transforming hospital training by turning mandatory education into an adventure. Representative_Docs: ['‘UK public have tougher stance on immigration and diversity than people in US’ People in the UK are less likely than their US counterparts to feel diversity strengthens society and more likely to have tougher attitudes on immigration, according to research. The findings are said to show that a common narrative about Britain being more socially liberal than America does not ring true across all issues. The National Centre for Social Research also found Reform UK voters in Britain were more likely than supporters of President Donald Trump in the US to say immigrants living in their country without permission should not be allowed to stay. While seven in 10 supporters of Mr Trump felt this way, the figure was almost eight in 10 (79%) among Reform followers. The researchers said they wanted to “better understand how public attitudes in the UK compare with those in the US, and the extent of polarisation in the two countries”. Their survey found 42% of people in the UK think there should be legal efforts to deport immigrants living here without permission, compared with just a third (33%) in the US. While almost two-thirds (64%) of respondents in the US felt diversity strengthens society, only around half (49%) of the UK public agreed. Representative_Docs: ["Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world’s largest dedicated to a single civilization. Representative_Docs: ["Andrew Tate running away from Jake Paul fight - 'I'm not ready' Andrew Tate made his feelings clear about the probability of getting into the boxing ring with fellow social media star Jake Paul. In the aftermath of both Tate and Paul losing their respective boxing matches this weekend, fans have called for the pair to face off against each other in the ring for their next bout. Paul's fight with Anthony Joshua was overshadowed by a woman pushing away a man in the crowd following a lewd act. Tate, a controversial influencer, took to social media after losing to Chase DeMoor by decision on Saturday’s Misfits Boxing event in Dubai. “I’m not ready for Jake,” Tate posted on X. “Time is the fire in which we all burn. Fighting is for young men.” Tate, 39, seemingly wants no part of the 28-year-old YouTuber-turned-boxer, or any boxer for that matter, after he was roughed up by DeMoor in his Misfits debut on Saturday. A longtime professional kickboxer, Tate finally tried his luck in the boxing ring after months of anticipation since the bout was originally announced in October. Students at Ashby High School are busy raising money and getting ready to pack their bags for a two-week learning experience in South Africa. ADVERTISEMENT When it is below zero, the main street in Ashby, Minnesota, is quiet. Fewer than 500 people call this Grant County town home, but lately the town is busy rallying around a group of high school students. In the basement of Peace Grue Lutheran in the middle of town, five high school students join veteran church quilters in tying quilts that the students will take on their trip to South Africa. "There is a reason the church ladies do this and not the guys," joked Kevin Fick, the girls\' weightlifting coach and organizer of the trip, of tying quilts the students will take with them as gifts. Not as tourists, but to learn about conservation on another continent. "Not a lot of kids get to do this," said student Hadley Hokanson, student. Representative_Docs: ['Buium, Demko lead Canucks to 2-1 win over Devils as post-Hughes era begins Published 12:10 pm Sunday, December 14, 2025 By Philip Wolf Vancouver Canucks defenceman Zeeb Buium, in NHL action Sunday, Dec. 25, 2025 against the New Jersey Devils at the Prudential Center in Newark, N.J. ( photo) Zeev Buium had a goal and an assist in his Vancouver Canucks debut, leading his new team to a 2-1 win over the host New Jersey Devils in NHL action Sunday afternoon at the Prudential Center in Newark, N.J. Buium, along with Marco Rossi and Liam Ohgren, were picked up by the Canucks in a blockbuster trade for Vancouver captain Quinn Hughes on Friday. Jake DeBrusk had the other goal for the Canucks (12-17-3), with Thatcher Demko sharp in making 25 saves for the goaltending win. Quinn’s brother Luke Hughes scored for the Devils (18-14-1). Former Canuck Jacob Markstrom stopped 13 of 15 shots and took the loss in goal.
